result.execSummary:
The defendant Steve Chairez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Texas sentence and 11CF1101

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Texas sentence and 11CF1101

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.  May not be a job which requires defendant to deal with client's money.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with all conditions of Texas probation.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Katie Gutowski in court.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.

Def does not appear.
State req bond mod.
Atty Gutowski req that bond be stayed.
BTC:  BW/BF ordered - stay 48 hours.  Bond motion denied at this time.

Back on record 3:21 PM.
Defendant appears.
BTC:  Vacate BW/BF.
Def req bond mod to allow def to go to work.
State objects.
BTC:  Bond mod denied.

Defendant Steve Chairez in court with attorney Katie Gutowski.  Defendant Steve Chairez in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.

BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1; DRI the balance in 11CF1101 & on count 1 in 14CF382; DRI 12CT198. Order a PSI.
Def- Requesting the bond be amended to $1,500 to $2,000 cash bond.
St- Objects to the bond being amended.
BTC: Bond modification is denied.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Steve Chairez in court with attorney Katie Gutowski.  Defendant Steve Chairez in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
Def- Have yet to receive full discovery so would like time to review that before a plea is entered.
BTC: Adj  Plea hearing scheduled for May 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.


**AMENDED 4/21/2017 Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340, in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator). Make all court appearances on time. All prior conditions to remain.**

NOTE: A $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

Defendant Steve Chairez in court with attorney Katie Gutowski.  Defendant Steve Chairez in custody. Dirk Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
St- Requesting the bond be set at $5,000 to $10,000 cash in each file.
Def- Requesting a total of $1,000 cash total in all 3 files. Would not object to being placed on GPS monitoring.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT. In 14CF682 bond set at $5,000 cash, 11CF1101 $5,000 cash & 12CT198 $100 cash bond. Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring. All prior conditios to remain.
  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2017 at 09:30 am.
